labels.extended-modbus: This device was found by scanning via fast Modbus
labels.try-normal-scan: If the required devices are not found, run slow scan. During this time, already configured devices will not be polled or accept commands

device_manager.failed_to_scan_error: Scan failed for ports: {{ failed_ports }}. Check logs for more information

labels.deactivating-by-cm: Disconnecting because a higher priority connection is available
labels.deactivated-by-cm: Disconnected because a higher priority connection is available
labels.confirm-delete-connection: Do you really want to delete the connection?
labels.main-deprecation-notice: Connections {{connections}} are setup in /etc/network/interfaces. They can be managed by NetworkManager - this is a modern configuration service, support for which is currently being developed in Wiren Board. To switch to NetworkManager, use a pre-defined connections (or create new from scratch) and remove deprecated
labels.main-deprecation-notice_one: Connection {{connections}} is setup in /etc/network/interfaces. It can be managed by NetworkManager - this is a modern configuration service, support for which is currently being developed in Wiren Board. To switch to NetworkManager, use a pre-defined one (or create a new from scratch) and remove deprecated
labels.sticky-connection-period: Deny SIM/Wi-Fi switching period in seconds
labels.sticky-connection-period-desc: The GSM modem can work with only one SIM card. To test connectivity, the current SIM card is disconnected and the tested one is connected. If a modem connection is successfully established with one of the SIM cards, do not switch the SIM card for testing for the specified period. This timeout also applies to Wi-Fi connections which also share a single physical wireless device.
labels.connectivity-url-desc: To test connectivity, the service sends an HTTP GET request to specified URL.
labels.connectivity-url-error-length: The minimum URL length is {{length}} characters
labels.connectivity-url-error-format: The URL must start with 'http://' or 'https://'
labels.connectivity-payload-desc: Connectivity check response content must contain specified string.
labels.switcher-desc: The service will automatically select the highest priority internet connection and route internet traffic through it. All connections except the modem will remain active and can be used for other tasks. The manager checks internet access every 5 seconds.

errors.write: Error writing config. See wb-mqtt-confed logs for details

errors.integer_min: Value must be an integer equal or bigger than {{min}}
errors.integer_max: Value must be an integer equal or less than {{max}}
errors.integer_minmax: Value must be an integer in the range from {{min}} to {{max}}
errors.number_min: Value must be a number equal or bigger than {{min}}
errors.number_max: Value must be a number equal or less than {{max}}
errors.number_minmax: Value must be a number in the range from {{min}} to {{max}}

factory_reset.title: Factory reset
factory_reset.warning1: Use "Select firmware file" button to update firmware and reset all settings to defaults
factory_reset.warning2: Use "Perform factory reset" button to reset all settings and software versions to factory defaults
factory_reset.modal_page:
All your data will be lost!

You must confirm this action. It cannot be undone.

update.title: Firmware update
update.expandrootfs: Expand rootfs, if firmware supports it
update.backup_first_page:
During update only files stored in /mnt/data are saved. Third-party software like nodered or SH will be removed!

Press Download backup to download a rootfs backup archive, where some useful files like third-party service configs may be stored.

This backup archive currently can't be used to restore Wiren Board state.
update.backup_second_page: Great! Now wait until file is downloaded and press Select firmware file button to begin update process.

errors.unavailable: Firmware update service is not available
errors.stalled: Firmware update stalled, something gone wrong

buttons.select_and_reset: Select firmware file and update with reset

errors.write: Error writing config. See wb-mqtt-confed logs for details
errors.device-config: Error in the settings of one or more devices
errors.deprecated: Device template is deprecated, use newer version
errors.with-subdevices: Device template is deprecated. Editing settings is no longer supported. It is recommended to use the new version of the template
errors.duplicate-mqtt-topic: MQTT id is the same as for {{device}}
errors.is-disconnected: The device is not responding. Check the physical connection of the RS-485 bus and the communication settings of the port and device, which should be the same
errors.update-error-generic: Error: {{error}}. If the device is not responding, it may be in bootloader mode, to restore use the "Find device" button and search for devices in bootloader mode. If restore failed, contact technical support.
errors.update-error-generic-component: Error: {{error}}. If the device works, but is not responding to component firmware updates, try to update again. If the device is not responding, it may be in bootloader mode, to restore use the "Find device" button and search for devices in bootloader mode. If restore failed, contact technical support.
errors.update-error-recoverable: If the device is not responding, it may be in bootloader mode, to restore use the "Find device" button and search for devices in bootloader mode.
errors.update-error-rpc-timeout: Check wb-mqtt-serial is up and running.
errors.update-error-download: File download error. Check the network connection.
errors.add-device: Add device error: {{error}}. See the wb-mqtt-serial system log for detailed information
errors.change-device-type: Changing device type error: {{error}}. See the wb-mqtt-serial system log for detailed information
errors.load-registers: Error loading current settings from device: {{error}}. Default values are displayed for parameters not present in the configuration file
